text: Does anyone have a clear solution and best practices to implement an SCSS solution into the boilerplate? I’m going to start one from scratch and re-consider how I’m currently approaching it.

• I’d like to be able to use theme variables
• not sure if I want to separate my CSS from the module folder yet
• need a mix of global and module-focused CSS yet
if I can figure out a low lift way to share the code I will

(got stuck setting up github acitons in the boilerplate) Seeing:
```error: src refspec master does not match any
error: failed to push some refs to '<https://github.com/akondratyuk-dev/cms-theme-boilerplate.git>'```
was this the issue or was it because actions are automatically disabled when forking from the boilerplate? That note should definitely be added to the docs.
1. what does the `123` intend to reference in: `Run `webpack --watch --env.account 123 --env.autoupload` to compile your project and automatically upload assets.
a single scss file is easy enough
swapping out `_module.scss` files `module.css` for each module folder seems impossible...
